thread.title: Florida attractions in August: Escher meets Dali and the science of ice cream
thread.title_full: Florida attractions in August: Escher meets Dali and the science of ice cream

author: Matt Mauney
title: Florida attractions in August: Escher meets Dali and the science of ice cream
text:
August plays tricks on your eyes when Escher comes to the Dali August too hot? Let ice cream science cool you down at Fort Lauderdale's MODS 
Art, art and more art highlight new exhibits opening across Florida this month. If science is more your thing, one Fort Lauderdale attraction offers the chance to learn the chemistry behind ice cream. 
Escher at the Dali 
Test your eyes and imagination with the latest exhibit at the Salvador Dali Museum in St. Petersburg. Caption Photo: Dali Museum Jim Abbott, Orlando Sentinel A Pablo Picasso exhibit is a must-see attraction at The Dali Museum in St. Petersburg. Here, a bench outside the museum is decorated in Picasso style. A Pablo Picasso exhibit is a must-see attraction at The Dali Museum in St. Petersburg. Here, a bench outside the museum is decorated in Picasso style. (Jim Abbott, Orlando Sentinel) Caption The Glass Enigma at the Dal√≠ Museum Geisha Barazarte Composed of more than 900 glass triangles. No two glass panels are identical. Composed of more than 900 glass triangles. No two glass panels are identical. (Geisha Barazarte) See more galleries Florida Museum Guide: Salvador Dali Museum, St. Petersburg The museum contains the largest collection of Dali's work outside of Spain. Eight masterworks and 96 oil paintings are among its 2,100 paintings, prints sculptures and drawings. The gift shop has plenty of twists on that melting-clock notion. 1000 3rd St. South, St. Petersburg, 727-823-3767, www.salvadordalimuseum.org Florida Museum Guide: Salvador Dali Museum, St. Petersburg The museum contains the largest collection of Dali's work outside of Spain. Eight masterworks and 96 oil paintings are among its 2,100 paintings, prints sculptures and drawings. The gift shop has plenty of twists on that melting-clock notion. 1000 3rd St. South, St. Petersburg, 727-823-3767, www.salvadordalimuseum.org 
"Escher at the Dali" features prints, drawings, a sculpture, wood blocks, a lithograph stone and posters by M.C. Escher, known for his "impossible constructions" and use of tessellation, in which shapes fit together perfectly without overlapping. 
From his most recognizable works like "Reptiles,""Drawing Hands" and "Waterfall" to rarely exhibited early drawings, this 135-work collection is full of visual illusions sure to both puzzle and mesmerize audiences. Also on display will be "Metamorphosis," an enormous woodcut from the Dutch artist, standing 13-1/2 feet tall.
